page.title: 12Gargrave, Other Streets.
page.content:
High Street runs diagonally across a rectangle formed by four old streets imaginatively named{North St., East {St., South St.}and{West St.}A small{ {Outfitters}is to be found on South St. On West St.{The Village Hall,}whilst on picturesque North St. is Dorothy Ward's{Gift Shop}in a converted barn.
Across the fine bridge over the River Aire,{Church St.}is another attractive street of old buildings.
{River Place}is an interesting area of old terraced cottages between the river and{Low Green.}
Most of the rest of the village has grown up since the 1920's.
